content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.88 - Executive Order No. 88: Establishing guidelines for the operation of the Community Advisory Committee

State Regulations
I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of New York, by
virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of the State
of New York, in order to ensure community participation during the planning
stages of the New York City Convention Center development by the Community

Advisory Committee established pursuant to the act suthorizing such convention
center development, do hereby establish the following guidelines for the
operation of said Community Advisory Committee. (1)

The Development Corporation will submit
to the Community Advisory Committee, at such time as the draft environmental
impact statement is available, or at such time prior thereto as the Development

Corporation deems appropriate: site survey, proposed general site plan showing
the location and use of the buildings and other structures and pedestrian and
vehicular entrances and exits, schematic drawings of the design of the

Convention Center indicating the arrangement and use of space, draft
environmental impact statement, traffic circulation plan, and proposals for
other construction at the site of the Convention Center and in the general
vicinity thereof. (2)

The Community

Advisory Committee may, if and to the extent it deems appropriate, conduct a
public hearing and prepare and submit written recommendations with respect to
such materials to the Development Corporation. If any such recommendations are
received within 60 days after the submission by the Development Corporation to
the Community Advisory Committee and are not adopted, the Development

Corporation shall not proceed with the actions which shall be the subject of
such recommendations until the Development Corporation has communicated in
writing its determination and the reasons therefor to the Community Advisory

Committee, which determinations shall be final and shall not be subject to
review. (3)

If, at any time
subsequent to the submission of materials to the Community Advisory Committee, there is a substantial alteration or amendment in the contents of the materials
theretofore submitted, the Development Corporation shall submit to the

Community Advisory Committee information with respect to the proposed
alteration or amendment. Any determination by the Development Corporation that
any such alteration or amendment is not substantial in nature shall be final
and shall not be subject to review. The Community Advisory Committee may, if
and to the extent it deems appropriate, conduct a public hearing and submit
recommendations with respect to the proposed alteration or amendment in
accordance with the procedure set forth above, but within 30 days of such
submission. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: April 3, 1979
